name: Floating Point
description: Floating Point is a peaceful, free game about using a grappling hook to swing yourself gracefully through randomly generated spaces. The only objective is to collect points, and the only thing that increases your points is swinging swiftly, smoothly and elegantly without hitting anything.
minimum_requirements: Минимальные: ОС: Windows XP Процессор: 1 GHz Оперативная память: 1 GB ОЗУ DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 60 MB Дополнительно: A mouse, rather than a trackpad, is recommended.

reviews.review_text: This game is pretty awesome, once you get down the basics that is of course. This Game is special, not in the bad way, This game has calm chilled music, but sadly not enough of that. Though i do hope that there will be more music later on (As Far As i know there are 7 Songs according to the Bandcamp album that is) but if not it's not too big of a problem, even though the music could get annoying after a while. Now for the Game mechanics. This game is basically a movement based game where you move around as a Pixel with a Grappling hook, while trying to earn Points. How to do that? Well just don't touch the Walls and stay fast to get a lot of points for collecting the Red bars that raise the longer you stay away from the Walls. It is hard though to get speed though (found a good way for myself for now). And Thats it for the Mechanics. So This game is a 7/10 in my opinion, mainly because there is not enough music to it. And i would really like to see a Scoreboard in future Updates to compare the Points to my Friends (and a way to save the points too that is). If there is a Scoreboard i am sorry and i did not see it.  TL;DR: Game is a 7/10,  Needs more Music. Fun to Play though. Go and Play it, Gets Addicting really fast.  I'll excuse myself for any Grammar and spelling errors since English is not my Main Language.
They give you a dot and a grappling hook of sorts. A 'few' hours later, and everyone you've ever cared about has abandoned you to your point-induced coma. 11/10

This is one of those games where I'm left speechless. The game is free, and it's only an 11MB download, which means you could have finished downloading it by the time you've finished reading this review.  The game presents itself in such a way you don't want to let go. You're this Spiderman-esque dot, swinging around by clicking in the direction of different blocks, throwing yourself into these lines. Once you go through them, it adds to your points score which offers no reward in itself, other than some sort of milky satisfaction for completionists.  It's hard to criticise a game that presents itself so lovely, and the fact it's free makes it hard to refuse. But unlike, for example Angry Birds, there is no sense of progression, and can get bored very quickly. Each level you move on to is just random block placement. I believe that lack of goal is what makes Floating Point what it is - it doesn't dress itself up, and there's no penalty for whatever.  It's a lovely game, but it personally isn't for me. It is very peaceful and relaxing, which some may find as a stress relief - which I imagine makes this someone's perfect cup of tea. Sadly, I prefer coffee. But I find myself firing this up now and then for some relaxation, and Floating Point works a treat.

It's a fun little game where you shoot a grappling hook at blocks and swing between other blocks to collect red beacons.  Each level is identicle in it's aesthetic and objectives and offers no variation. There isn't much to it. But what there is, it does really well.  The swinging is responsive and if you practice enough, allows you to completely avoid every obsticle, giving you maximum points. There are 2 areas, air and water. In the air, gravity pulls you down. In the water, buoyancy pushes you up. This forces you to be able to switch your swinging techniques as you fling yourself between the 2.  This game rewards good players. The beacons that must be collected grow when you move quickly without hitting obsticles, and shrink when you crash or slow down. This means that if you're not good at the game, the game becomes more difficult just to rub it in. This, however, is not a criticism. Too many games are letting the bad player get off too easy these days.  That said, this game is not challenging. Then again, it's not supposed to be. As is written above in the 'About the Game' section, Floating Point is a 'peaceful game'. There is no failure state, no time, and when you beat a level, you can spend the next hour drawing squiggly lines and patterns.  It's a small, but fun game, with a great, yet simplistic artstyle, calming music and enjoyable swinging mechanics.
amazing fun smooth and so calming
A simple, fun, and relaxing game.

Floating Point, this is a game that thee's no million zombies rushing at your for your brains, or a ton of terrorists trying to blow up the city. This game is surprising relaxing, casual and amazing experience to play. Got a spare 5 mins before work, school, or even football training? Just launch Floating Point. Playing this game for ten minutes feels like 30, and it is all so rewarding when you can swing yourself across the level at a hundred miles per hour and get that last beam of light to unlock all the traces of where you have been. Once you complete a level and press enter you transfor yourself, a little ball thing, into the background of the previous level. The music is so relaxing and vibrant, and I love how the sound of it gets 'distorted' when you go under water. When you go under water you lose a lot of momentum and it's a lot harder to get in the water then above the water. Another thing about the water is that you float in it, so it's very hard to get far enough to get those deep level beams of light you need to travel through. The aim of the game is to pretty much fly through these red beams of light (which also get shorter if you hit a wall) and progress through many levels. In all this is a MUST download (as it's a free game), so what are you waiting for? It's only about 54 MB and it's free! Get it before they put a pricetag on this wonderful creation of a game! =D
my friend show this to me one night and i havent put it down since

This game is simply amazing. It's also pretty simple, but with a suprising amount of learning needs to take place to fully grasp the grappling mechanics. At worst, this game is simple, at best, it is a theraputic game with an addiction level that I've fell victim of already. After about 30 mins of play, you'll be swinging better than Spider-Man ever did and you'll feel great nailing pinpoint moves. A superb game, ideal for those lazy Sundays with nothing else to do; put on this game and have a casual swing-about, and all of a sudden your time is gone. Learn the ropes and you'll be sucked in to what is one of the most beatiful games I've played in a while. Oh, and it's free.

This is a neat little game. After jumping in, the concept may take some getting used to -- but, once you get the hang of it, your actions feel much less random and pointless (something like button-mashing), and once you get good at it, it's anything but boring.   Sooner or later you'll figure out how the scoring system works, and you'll really be pushing to beat your high score which can be especially frustrating with how slow the ball moves. However, that doesn't matter, because this game offers settings that allow you to change the values of the game properties (the strengths of retraction, block density, etc.). Every time I found something I didn't like about this game, there was some way around that catered to my personal preference. There are a number of little extra things you'll run into that will leave you thinking, 'oh, hey, that's kinda cool!'  Yup yup, obviously I recommend this game. I mean, I actually wrote like a paragraph about it.
It's a great game. Get it. For free.

Just got done playing the game for ~20 minutes after just downloading it. It's definitely an interesting game. It's simple enough that it doesn't require any prior game knowledge to play, yet as the game progresses, it becomes more challenging to keep that ball flowing smoothly, which is arguably the main objective of the game (that, and collecting the long rectangles). The art design is sleek, minimalist but looks fantastic, and it interacts very well with the music through the 2 'areas' of the map (Air and Water I'm assuming?). All in all, it's a good game, considering it's free. There isn't much depth to it, I don't think that it requires you to master any set of skills, but it's fun for what it's worth, and the music keeps the whole thing flowing well.

An enjoyable free-to-play game which is perfect for killing time. The smooth, responsive controls make possible a variety of speeds and movements allowing players to create effortless patterns and complete satisfying sequences. This game does present a challenge to beginners but is designed so that even complete novices can easily progress through levels without to much fustration while more experianced players can complete the smoother and faster movement required to score more points.  Overall a very fun little game especially when you consider it is free and contains NO micro-transactions

This game is very simple. but it's beautiful. The music is calming and it's really the game to play when you get back from school or work and it's been a stressful day. I like the ambience for when you go under the water it gets a bit dampened, and when you come out of the water it's sharper again. The physics are awesome and there's no better feeling than going really fast and collecting a bunch of those little bars. There's no time limit whatsoever and even when you finish the level you can go and swing around for as long as you want until you feel like going on again. Plus. it doesn't really get old seeing as you can edit the gravity and the length of the level and everything. I have a feeling I'll enjoy this game for a LONG time before I get bored. I'd give this game a 9/10 and you should DEFINITELY try it out.

Once you get into the 'swing' of things it gets easier to score higher. I still haven't messed with the settings to make it more difficult, but there is plenty of options. I like that you can pick up or leave at any time, no hunting for save points or spending all day waiting on special events. It does one task and does it very well. Let me tell you about Floating Point This is a beautiful game, it's simple art style, enjoyable gameplay and accurate physics make it a relaxing and enjoyable experience. The music combined with the colours and the simple control scheme make for an enjoyable game that you can turn on for 10 minutes and have some fun.  The points system is brilliant, and completely unnecessary should you want to ignore it. The more momentum you build up, the more points you can gain from the bars you must swing into. Or, should you prefer, feel free just to swing around like an absolute maniac.  Floating point is almost a thank you to the community from it's developer, Tom Francis, for allowing him to do what he loves. Make Games. It's free, It's a small download, and It starts up in under 30 seconds. Why would you not download it?

It's a nice game of skill, using at least one's reaction time, spatial accuracy and spatial awareness. Fun game if you plan to play for only a short time or are a person that likes achieving high scores, and also if you like swinging like Spiderman.

Floating Point is an incredibly simple indie game in which you must swing into large red rectangles using a grappling hook. The speed at which you are swinging throughout the level determines the amount of points each rectangle is worth.   Also, you're a speck. That is the protagonist in this game. It doesn't utter a single word. This game reminded me a lot of Thomas Was Alone. All in all, this is a really good F2P indie game for killing a few minutes or just relaxing.
Great game to just sit back and screw around with for 10 minutes at a time.
This game has a very interesting concept, but the some parts are a bit lacking.     What could be improved

I give this a strong 9/10. Really good if you want a quick relaxing session. It may seem simple, but it`s more addicting than flappy bird.

Really, this is the first game I've felt really deserves a +1. Smooth gameplay, soothing music and a simplistic theme make it relaxing and fun. I'd honestly be happy to pay money for this.
Scarier than FNAF, more intense than GTA V, THIS.... IS..... Floating Point. And yes, I am a basement dweller for playing that long.

So, why should you download this?  +Even if the music is always the same, it's very relaxing and it never get's boring! +The change betwheen the water and the air is just.. A great way to waste your life 10/10

Floating Point is a very peaceful 2D game about throwing yourself around randomly generated worlds. These worlds contain blocks which you have to grapple yourself onto, and on these blocks, there are red bars which are essentially your goal in the game - collect these bars to score points and to progress through the game.   The controls of the game are quite hard to learn, but once you get the hang of them, the challenging element to the controls suddenly become a really helpful, swinging from block to block, collecting the red bars, this game can offer you a good few hours of fun.  The soundtrack to the game is really calming - matching the games theme, it fits well with what you are doing in the game.  This game is FREE on Steam! So I'd suggest to download it now, it takes seconds to download and it's a really fun game if you're bored and looking for something to do.
This is a free game play this game NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW!
It’s like Pixel Junk Eden from the PS3! It's so basic and Zen. Easy to get into and quite enjoyable to master.
A fun free little game to enjoy.

This game I love. The Gameplay will get more harder but if you try to rage you can't. It's the soundtrack. It's so calming and relives stress easy even when you are happy you still feel calm. I like how the gameplay is simple but smart. With the levels, you can find new ways to complete them, easy or hard.  I give this a clean 10. Thanks guys for making this. In my 7 mins of gameplay I feel calm.
Wonderful, wonderful relaxing game. The grapple mechanics feel perfect. If you're looking to relax a bit, or just kill some time, this is a must-download.

Good sit down and play game, even if its only for 5 minutes, really enjoyable.

I've only played it a little, but it was enough for me to write this review. This is a simple physics game, and it's free to play because it's one of those games that you could play anywhere with a browser. But the game isn't bad. After learning the controls, you'll like this game, but some like me will only like it a bit, but others will love it. You should try it, it deserves a shot. The music is cool, and you can customise the physics to change the gameplay (the best feature for these kind of games). Besides getting a high score, there's no other objectives or progression here. Just pick and play.
Why is this free to play i want to support these developers so much. 10/10 on EA Sports you swing around and do geometry and have fun while chilling 10/10
Strongly recommend. I play in one window while I watch netflix and youtube in the other. Great fun.

Fun and relaxing game.... just as it says. 10/10 Definitely download this game. I'ts worth playing 3 hours a day over.
If you ever wanted to be a 2 D Spiderman without the gay costume, and wanted to actually be limited by physics and the need for your webs to actually stick to something, this is the game for you.

This game can be good for playing in short bursts, or can be played for hours on end. I personally play this about 10-15 minutes before school everyday, and I don't feel like I need to keep playing but more that it will be nice to come back to when school is done.

One hour and i still love it. At times it can be infuriating but its always a piece of physics that you forgot for example. The one thing i would say is that it perfectly explains what a spiderman esque web swinging should be like to the player. I love it
Very good game. Good phisics, good customzation, and very good ideals. You should make this into a mobile app.
An intresting game, very easy to be learned, and funny. Little boring because you have to do the same thing all time.   9/10 game.
Perfect game if you're looking to relax and have some time to think. Maybe listen to a podcast while you play. Something fun to do just to pass the time.

This is a great game. Controls are on pointe, a nice, sleek design, yet simple, yet complex. The 'physics(?)' are great, the momentum carries through the fulcrum created by your rope; Best F2P game ever. I recommend this one to anyone who is looking for a calming and fun game.

This little indie game can be relaxing exciting all at once. This is perfect for when your looking through your library, (Steam, X-Box, Wii, ect.) and you just don't know what to play. This is also an icredibly simple game, in terms of controls and consept. The music is also something to praise. Being a musician myself, I find it nothing special by technicallity, by it fits the game's concept so well. The game is also easy one the eyes, by which I mean you could play it in the dark and still bareilly stress your eyes.     All around, an awesome game!
This game can be an entertaining, relaxing, and rewarding experienence.
Simple and calming.
saw it on a video, now addicting
Pretty chill game if your looking to waste some time . The game is pretty easy to get used to .
This game is relaxing. It's fun. It's simple. It's free. What more could you want?
Its alright. fun at first, but gets a little repetative :/

Floating point is a very good swing em up (Thats what I call games like this) that allows you to swing around all over the place without a care in the world. And for a free game, HOT DAMN IS IT GOOD. So the preimise of this game is that you swing around on diffrent blocks in order to collect red bars and as far as I can tell if you hit the blocks or lose momentom, they go down. I dont know if them going down counts to your points. Now bellow you there is water, and the water makes it so you need momentom to swing you down into it and get the bars below. If you dont have momentom you rise out of the water. Now if your good you can keep a steady motion and collect all the bars without touching any of the black boxes which I cant do, but if you can, good on yah. Now when you collect all the bars your dot turns white and you can swing around freely, but the the bars in the background either increses or decreses. Now you can press space bar to go to the next area in the background and do the same thing again execpt try to get a better score. Every floor (Thats what I call it.) resets your score so you have to try to get a better one.   Section 2: Tricks. A fun little trick is to wrap your grapling rope around a block so that you do circles around that block and eventually launch super fast. This is useful if you want to get down into the water.    Section 3: Recomendation. Well, what can I say? First off a free game never hurts and seccond, its just plain fun! If the simple and calming gameplay doesnt hook you than the nice soundtrack will. If im ever mad its nice to sit down and play some of this game to calm me down, and I reccomend you do the same.     Section End: Rating. This game is definitly one of the better free games I've played that doesn't say: Hey you! Yes you there! Do you want to play a free game full of microtransactions that ultimitly make you feel like your progressing but you really arent? Then take a look at 'Insert clash of clans rip off that is exactly like the other game and is crap because the base game is crap'. So yeah, a solid 10/10. (Extra point because its free.)
A very fun Time waster.

Chronology of Floating Point:  - You collide into 20 walls and slow to crawl before finally making it through a bar. You are content.  - You quickly get a hang of the controls and score a few points sailing gracefully across the map. You are entertained.  - You hookshot repeatedly for many minutes and reach incredible speeds, trying to set up the perfect path, then collide with a platform by a millimeter, slow to a crawl, and sigh audibly before resigning to try all over again. You are determined.  - You finally punch the air as you watch yourself sail majestically through space, blasting through gates with incredible precision and racking up hundreds of thousands of points. You are ecstatic.  - You check the score thread and discover someone casually hit a few million in the time it took you to hit one gate, but you don't care because the gameplay is smooth as butter, the ambient sountrack is relaxing, and you can watch back your beutifully intricate, criss-crossed kaleidoscope of trails for eternity. You are addicted.
